meanings.definition: The condition of having an abnormal accumulation of fluid in tissues or cavities of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hydropsies after noticing the swelling in their legs.
meanings.sent2: The hydropsies in his abdomen made it difficult for him to breathe properly.
meanings.sent3: Carrying around a water balloon suit for a day would give anyone a taste of hydropsies.
meanings.sent4: Her tears flowed like hydropsies, soaking her cheeks with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dam bursting was a perfect metaphor for the sudden onset of hydropsies.
